com.foreach.across.modules.filemanager.services

Class FileManagerImpl

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.foreach.across.modules.filemanager.services.FileManagerImpl
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    FileManager, FileRepository, FileRepositoryRegistry

    @Service
public class FileManagerImpl
extends Object
implements FileManager, FileRepositoryRegistry
    Implementation of both FileManager and FileRepositoryRegistry. The registry deals out delegate implementations ensuring that the actual implementation can be replaced at runtime.
    See Also:
    FileRepositoryDelegate

    • Field Summary

      • Fields inherited from interface com.foreach.across.modules.filemanager.services.FileManager

        DEFAULT_REPOSITORY, TEMP_REPOSITORY

      • createFileResource

        public FileResource createFileResource(String repositoryId)
        Description copied from interface: FileManager
        Create a new writable file resource in the given repository.
        Specified by:
        createFileResource in interface FileManager
        Parameters:

        Returns:
        file resource

      • createFileResource

        public FileResource createFileResource()
        Description copied from interface: FileRepository
        Create a new file resource in the repository. The resource returned is guaranteed not to exist before the call to this method, and can normally be written to (can effectively be created).

        This does not allocate the physical storage for the actual file, that should only happen when actual data is written to the file resource. If you want to create a new file resource and immediately allocate it, use FileRepository.createFileResource(boolean) instead.

        This method usually does the same as calling createFileResource(false).

        Specified by:
        createFileResource in interface FileRepository
        Returns:
        FileResource instance.

      • createFileResource

        public FileResource createFileResource(boolean allocateImmediately)
        Description copied from interface: FileRepository
        Create a new file resource in the repository and optionally allocate it immediately. The resource returned is guaranteed not to exist before the call to this method, and can normally be written to after. The call to Resource.exists() should return true if parameter allocateImmediately was true.

        Allocating the file usually creates an empty physical file or the equivalent for the underlying storage engine.

        Specified by:
        createFileResource in interface FileRepository
        Parameters:
        allocateImmediately - true if
        Returns:
        FileResource instance.

      • createFileResource

        public FileResource createFileResource(File originalFile,
                                       boolean deleteOriginal)
                                throws IOException
        Description copied from interface: FileRepository
        Create a new file in the repository. This allocates the file resource and copies the data of the file parameter.

        If parameter deleteOriginal is true, the original file will be deleted once the resource has been created. This is useful when moving temporary files.

        By default the extension of the original file will be added to the file descriptor, so it can more easily be used for mime type detection.

        Specified by:
        createFileResource in interface FileRepository
        Parameters:
        originalFile - data to copy into the resource
        deleteOriginal - true if the original file should be deleted when done
        Returns:
        FileResource instance.
        Throws:
        IOException

      • createFileResource

        public FileResource createFileResource(InputStream inputStream)
                                throws IOException
        Description copied from interface: FileRepository
        Create a new file in the repository. This allocates the file resource and copies the data represented by the inputStream parameter. It is the responsibility of the caller to correctly close the input stream when done.

        By default this does the same as FileRepository.createFileResource() followed by a call to FileResource.copyFrom(InputStream).

        Specified by:
        createFileResource in interface FileRepository
        Parameters:
        inputStream - data to copy into the resource
        Returns:
        FileResource instance
        Throws:
        IOException

      • getFileResource

        public FileResource getFileResource(FileDescriptor descriptor)
        Description copied from interface: FileRepository
        Returns the FileResource represented by the descriptor. Should never be null. An IllegalArgumentException will be thrown if the descriptor does not match the repository or is illegal in any way.

        Note that this does not mean that the actual file resource exists. Only a call to Resource.exists() would verify that. The return value simply implies that a resource matching that descriptor could exist or be created.

        Specified by:
        getFileResource in interface FileRepository
        Parameters:
        descriptor - to get the file resource for
        Returns:
        file resource

        Specified by:

        Returns:
        root folder resources

      • getFolderResource

        public FolderResource getFolderResource(FolderDescriptor descriptor)
        Description copied from interface: FileRepository
        Returns the FolderResource represented by the descriptors, should never be null. An IllegalArgumentException will be thrown if the descriptor does not match the repository or is illegal in any way.

        Note that this does not mean that the actual folder resource exists. Only a call to FileRepositoryResource.exists() would verify that. The return value simply implies that a resource matching that descriptor could exist or be created.

        Specified by:
        getFolderResource in interface FileRepository
        Parameters:
        descriptor - to get the folder resource for
        Returns:
        folder resource

      • createTempFile

        public File createTempFile()
        Description copied from interface: FileManager
        Quick creates a physical file in the temporary FileRepository. The file returned can safely be used for writing to and can afterwards be moved into a specific file resource.
        Specified by:
        createTempFile in interface FileManager
        Returns:
        A File instance to be used.

        Specified by:

      • createFile

        public FileDescriptor createFile()
        Description copied from interface: FileRepository
        Create a new file in the repository. This allocates the file instance, but the content of the file is empty. What exactly empty means depends on the implementation of the repository.

        Deprecated as of 1.4.0, us FileRepository.createFileResource(boolean) instead and explicitly indicate if a blank file should be allocated.

        Specified by:
        createFile in interface FileRepository
        Returns:
        FileDescriptor instance.

      • moveInto

        public FileDescriptor moveInto(File file)
        Description copied from interface: FileRepository
        Moves a File into the repository, once the file is fully available in the repository an attempt will be made to delete the original file.

        No exception will be thrown if the delete fails as the new instance will be available in the repository already and this is considered the important part of the transaction.

        Specified by:
        moveInto in interface FileRepository
        Parameters:
        file - File instance to move into the repository.
        Returns:
        FileDescriptor instance.

      • save

        public FileDescriptor save(File file)
        Description copied from interface: FileRepository
        Stores a file in the repository, but leaves the original file alone. If you want to move a temporary file to the repository and delete it immediately when done, use FileRepository.moveInto(java.io.File) instead.
        Specified by:
        save in interface FileRepository
        Parameters:
        file - File instance to save in the repository.
        Returns:
        FileDescriptor instance.

                           File file)

        Stores a file in the repository, but leaves the original file alone. If you want to move a temporary file to the repository and delete it immediately when done, use FileRepository.moveInto(java.io.File) instead.
        Specified by:
        save in interface FileManager
        Parameters:
        repositoryId - Id of the file repository.
        file - File instance to save in the repository.

      • save

        public void save(FileDescriptor target,
                 InputStream inputStream,
                 boolean replaceExisting)
        Description copied from interface: FileRepository
        Stores a file for a specified FileDescriptor in the repository. The repository defined in the file descriptor should match the FileRepository the method is executed for.

        If the file may not be replaced and a file exists, an exception will be thrown.

        Specified by:
        save in interface FileRepository
        Parameters:
        target - FileDescriptor that should be used for the file.
        inputStream - InputStream of the file content.
        replaceExisting - Whether an existing file at the same location should be replaced.

      • moveInto

        public FileDescriptor moveInto(String repositoryId,
                               File file)
        Description copied from interface: FileManager
        Moves a File into the repository, once the file is fully available in the repository an attempt will be made to delete the original file.

        No exception will be thrown if the delete fails as the new instance will be available in the repository already and this is considered the important part of the transaction.

        Specified by:
        moveInto in interface FileManager
        Parameters:
        repositoryId - Id of the file repository.
        file - File instance to move into the repository.
        Returns:
        FileDescriptor instance.

      • delete

        public boolean delete(FileDescriptor descriptor)
        Description copied from interface: FileRepository
        Deletes a file from the repository. The return value is a hint concerning the delete action as the correct status information depends on the underlying storage engine.

        In general a return value of true means there was no obvious failure deleting the file, but does not guarantee that all resources have been deleted. On the other hand, a return value of false guarantees that the file resource was not deleted and still exists.

        Specified by:
        delete in interface FileRepository
        Parameters:
        descriptor - FileDescriptor instance.
        Returns:
        false if delete failed

      • getOutputStream

        public OutputStream getOutputStream(FileDescriptor descriptor)
        Description copied from interface: FileRepository
        Get an OutputStream that can be used to update the contents of the file. No matter the repository implementation, writes to the OutputStream should replace the existing contents.

        Depending on the implementation, this can happen on close(), flush() or instantaneously.

        Specified by:
        getOutputStream in interface FileRepository
        Parameters:
        descriptor - FileDescriptor instance.
        Returns:
        OutputStream that can be used to update the contents of the file.

      • getInputStream

        public InputStream getInputStream(FileDescriptor descriptor)
        Description copied from interface: FileRepository
        Get an InputStream to read the contents of the file. Reading the stream *should not be done more than once* to ensure compatibility across FileRepository implementations. Once a stream has been consumed, a new InputStream should be requested of the repository.

        If the file does not exist null will be returned.

        Specified by:
        getInputStream in interface FileRepository
        Parameters:
        descriptor - FileDescriptor instance.
        Returns:
        InputStream for the contents of the file.

      • getAsFile

        public File getAsFile(FileDescriptor descriptor)
        Description copied from interface: FileRepository
        Gets the file contents as a File instance. This file *should not be used for writing* as the file instance might be a local cached instance depending on the implementation. If you want to write directly you should use FileRepository.getOutputStream(FileDescriptor).

        WARNING: As of 1.4.0 this method has been deprecated and you should avoid using it altogether. If you want to retrieve a resource as a file, use the FileResource.copyTo(File) instead and explicitly provide the file instance where you would like the output. However, you should avoid using File and use the InputStream wherever possible.

        Specified by:
        getAsFile in interface FileRepository
        Parameters:
        descriptor - FileDescriptor instance.
        Returns:
        File instance.

      • exists

        public boolean exists(FileDescriptor descriptor)
        Description copied from interface: FileRepository
        Quick check if a descriptor actually points to an existing file resource. Equivalent of doing Resource.exists().
        Specified by:
        exists in interface FileRepository
        Parameters:
        descriptor - FileDescriptor instance.
        Returns:
        True if the file exists.

      • move

        public boolean move(FileDescriptor source,
                    FileDescriptor target)
        Description copied from interface: FileRepository
        Moves the file "original" into "renamed", which may not exist yet.

        An IllegalArgumentException will be thrown if the two are not in the same repository.
        Specified by:
        move in interface FileRepository
        Parameters:
        source - FileDescriptor instance of the original file.
        target - FileDescriptor instance of the wanted resulting file.
        Returns:
        True if the file was successfully moved.

      • repositoryExists

        public boolean repositoryExists(String repositoryId)
        Description copied from interface: FileRepositoryRegistry
        Checks if a FileRepository with the given id exists. Will not attempt to create it if it does not.
        Specified by:

      • registerRepository

        public FileRepository registerRepository(FileRepository fileRepository)
        Description copied from interface: FileRepositoryRegistry
        Adds a FileRepository to the registry. This will replace the currently registered repository with that name. This method can return a different instance of the FileRepository that is supposed to be used instead of the original passed in. The default FileManagerImpl wraps provided FileRepository instances in a FileRepositoryDelegate so they can be replaced at runtime.
        Specified by:
        registerRepository in interface FileRepositoryRegistry
        Parameters:
        fileRepository - FileRepository instance.
        See Also:
        FileRepositoryDelegate

        public Collection<FileRepository> listRepositories()
        Specified by:
        listRepositories in interface FileRepositoryRegistry
        Returns:
        collection of all registered repositories

      • findResources

        public <U extends FileRepositoryResource> Collection<U> findResources(String pattern,
                                                                      Class<U> resourceType)
        Description copied from interface: FileRepository
        Find all resources matching the given ANT pattern in this repository. This is the equivalent of starting a search from the root folder of the repository.
        Specified by:
        findResources in interface FileRepository
        Parameters:
        pattern - to match
        resourceType - type of resources to return
        Returns:

        Returns:

      • shutdown

        @PreDestroy
public void shutdown()
        Signal shutdown of the file manager to all repositories. This also removes all registered repositories, even though after a call to shutdown the manager can be reused.
